ratings.comment: McMaster made lectures fun and easy to understand, and made content relatable by including his own personal stories. The course was graded on a few items, though these items were not hard to earn full points for if you did the readings and watched what content he assigned. Lectures were over in a blink of an eye and the class was truly interesting.
Professor McMaster takes his material seriously and so should you! He makes class engaging and cares for his students. Definitely recommend. Would take another class with him again.

Professor McMaster was probably one of my favorite professors this past semester. He's genuinely so funny and leads really thought-provoking class discussions. The readings for this class were very manageable (only one or two per lecture, and sometimes he would assign plays/movies for us to watch instead of reading).

Professor McMaster is one of the best professors I have ever had! Lectures fly by because they are so interesting and hold my attention. I am looking to take more classes with him because he is such a good professor and truly cares about his students!

He's very very passionate about what he teaches and is one of the most personable professors I've ever had. If you're looking for an impactful humanities class to take, seek out GWS/SOC 200 with McMaster.

I personally think that Professor McMaster is great! He has a good way of teaching the class AND he is very knowledgable on the things he discusses + is also passionate about said topics. Yes, this class does have at least 2 readings per week, but it really isn't that hard to go over! He also goes over confusing topics from the readings as well.

Professor McMaster is absolutely incredible. He is extremely knowledgeable about the material and presents it in a hilarious way. Many times the entire hall burst out laughing. Homework consists of daily readings (which sometimes have pop quizzes in lectures) and 2 essays.  If you are at all interested, TAKE THIS CLASS!

Lectures feel kind of pointless, but attendance is required. It's just a summary of the readings, which have to be done before class because of random attendance quizzes based on the readings. Overall, Lecture feels like a waste of time, but James brings a lot of personality into it so it's not completely mind-numbing.
